definition[0]: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose
example[0]: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
example[2]: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
example[4]: international organizations such as the UN
definition[1]: planning and arranging something so that it is successful or effective
example[5]: Putting on a show of this kind involves considerable organisation.
example[6]: The college has helped Anne with the organization of the event.
definition[2]: the way in which the different parts of a system are arranged and work together
example[7]: There needs to be a change in the organization of the health service.
definition[3]: a group of people, companies, or countries, which is set up for a particular purpose
example[8]: Greenpeace is an international organization that protects the environment.
definition[4]: a large important organization such as a bank, church, or university
example[10]: The University is an important academic institution.
definition[5]: an organization for people in a particular profession, sport, or activity, which officially represents its members – often used in names
example[12]: I met a representative of the National Association of Teachers.
definition[6]: an organization of people with the same political aims which you can vote for in elections
example[14]: Which political party do you support?
example[15]: He voted for the Republican Party’s candidate.
definition[7]: an important group of people who make the rules and advise people about what should be allowed
example[17]: The government has set up an advisory body.
definition[8]: an organization for people who share an interest, for example a sport
example[18]: We belong to a tennis club.
example[19]: I joined the university film society.
definition[9]: an organization formed by workers in order to protect their rights
example[20]: The union ordered its members out on strike.
definition[10]: an organization which collects money to help people who are poor, sick etc and does not make any profit for itself
example[21]: She has raised a lot of money for local charities.
definition[11]: an organization set up by the government, which has official power but whose members have not been elected
example[22]: the amount of money that is wasted on government quangos
definition[12]: a company, business, group etc that has been formed for a particular purpose
example[24]: Federal officials making the grants consider such factors as an organization’s ability to raise other funds.
definition[13]: the planning and arranging of work of a particular business, company, group etc
example[25]: new management methods that challenge classical ideas about organisation
definition[14]: someone working for a company who never takes risks and always agrees with the people in authority
example[26]: Entrepreneurial types are more creative and experimental - without them organization Man and Woman will suffer.
